info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:12PM MDT by NWS Missoula MT
info.description:
At 410 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Garrison, or 13 miles north of Deer Lodge, moving northeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy localized rainfall, and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar and satellite indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain could cause ponding on roadways with minor localized flooding possible.
Locations impacted include... Deer Lodge, Garrison, Finn, Jens, Brock Creek, Goldcreek, Avon, and Elliston.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 161 and 182. Highway 12 Garrison to MacDonald Pass between mile markers 0 and 18.
info.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
